active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the sufficiency of XTS-AES for modern block storage security: Argue for and against its use given gaps in authentication/integrity and key management. Reference NIST SP 800-38E and real-world breaches (e.g., Capital One AWS incident). Synthesize consensus on required enhancements.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator specializing in cybersecurity education. Generate high-quality, spaced-repetition-optimized flashcards for the topic 'Block Storage Encryption Gaps' (Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security Architecture And Engineering > Security Architecture Vulnerabilities > Cloud Architecture Vulnerabilities > Cloud Storage Architecture Vulnerabilities > Block Storage Encryption Gaps). Base content on NIST SP 800-38E (XTS-AES: confidentiality only, no auth/integ for storage devices), SP 800-209 (storage security, key mgmt, end-to-end), gaps (XTS-AES lacks auth/integ, SAN key mgmt issues, incomplete transit coverage), and cases like Capital One AWS breach. Incorporate pedagogy: - Learning objectives: [insert full list above]. - Active learning: Inspire critical thinking via objectives (e.g., analysis prompts). - Scaffolding: Distribute cards across 4 layers [insert full scaffolding above]; progress from foundation to integration. - Voter consensus: Clarity on gaps, higher Bloom's (analyze/compare/critique/design), concept maps, hands-on refs (AWS EBS/SAN labs), measurable verbs. Follow EXACT flashcard schema [insert full schema above]. Output ONLY a JSON array of 25-35 flashcards, grouped by scaffolding_layer (e.g., {"layer1": [...], "layer2": [...]}). Ensure distractors are realistic (e.g., confuse XTS with GCM). Cards must be concise (front <100 chars), accurate, and engaging for university-level learners.
